==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|に|ころ|ふな|k2=ごろ|k3=ぶな|yomi=k|r=y}}
[[File:Carassius_auratus_grandoculis_by_OpenCage.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|ニゴロブナ}}]]

===Etymology===
Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=にごろぶな|似る|alt1=似|tr1=ni|t1=resembles|源五郎鮒|alt2=五郎鮒|tr2=gorōbuna}}, short for {{l|ja|源五郎鮒}}.

Variously spelled in kanji as {{l|ja|煮頃鮒}} or {{l|ja|似五郎鮒}}. The {{lang|ja|煮頃}} spelling for ''nigoro'' is likely [[ateji]]. Meanwhile, the {{lang|ja|似五郎鮒}} spelling points to the likely derivation: this spelling parses out to "resembling (gen)gorō-buna", and as the ''nigorobuna'' grows to sizes of 30cm or longer, it begins to resemble the {{l|ja|源五郎鮒}} ({{l|ja|ゲンゴロウブナ}}, ''gengorōbuna''), a closely related species also endemic to the lake.

Like many [[biology]] terms, this word is often spelled in katakana, as {{l|ja|ニゴロブナ}}. When written in [[kanji]], the {{lang|ja|煮頃鮒}} spelling is more common.

===Pronunciation===
* {{ja-pron|yomi=k|にごろぶな|acc=4|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|にごろぶな|ニゴロブナ}}

# [[nigorobuna]] (''[[Carassius auratus grandoculis]]''), a type of {{m|ja|鮒|tr=funa||[[crucian carp]]}}, an [[edible]] freshwater ray-finned fish related to [[carp]] and [[goldfish]], endemic to [[Lake Biwa]] in Japan
